extraMetadata.title: Hardware Across the Web
extraMetadata.description: Hardware Across the Web is a public weekly report of the hardware used by a representative sample of the population from Firefox's release channel on desktop. This information can be used by developers to improve the Firefox experience for users.

resolution.title: Display Resolution
resolution.description: Two display resolutions—1366x768px and 1920x1080px—stand out as the most highly used resolutions, with the latter showing an upward trend.

gpuVendor.title: GPU Vendor
gpuVendor.description: The share of GPU vendors shows little change over the course of 2016, with Intel chipsets making up nearly two-thirds of all GPUs.

hasUnity.title: Unity
hasUnity.description: As of March 2016, Unity dropped support for the Unity Web Player in favor of WebGL export.

cpuSpeed.title: CPU Speeds
cpuSpeed.description: A quarter of users have processors with clock speeds between 2.3 GHz and 2.69 GHz.

ram.title: Memory
ram.description: A third of users have 4GB of memory, trending up. The number of users with 8GB of memory is also trending up.

cpuCores.title: CPU Cores
cpuCores.description: Nearly 70% of users have machines with two physical cores.

cpuVendor.title: CPU Vendor
cpuVendor.description: The share of CPU vendors shows little change over the course of 2016, with Intel making up nearly 86% of all CPUs.

osName.title: Operating System
osName.description: Users on Windows 10 showed a noticeable increase in the first half of 2016. Only Ubuntu and Mozilla builds of Linux are currently being tracked.

browserArch.title: Browsers by Architecture
browserArch.description: In 2017, 64-bit Firefox updates fully unthrottled on Win7+ for 2GB+ users.

osArch.title: Operating Systems by Architecture
osArch.description: The share of 32-to-64-bit operating systems showed no remarkable change during 2016. Note that this metric likely undercounts non-Windows OSs, seeing as it relies on the environment.system.isWow64 Telemetry field.

hasFlash.title: Flash
hasFlash.description: Flash availability on Firefox shows a downward trend; Adobe will be ending support in 2020.
